channel.title: Thingiverse - Newest Things
channel.description: The newest and coolest things from Thingiverse.com

item.title: BMW M52TU_M54 - Throttlebody adapter M50 intake
item.description: Adapter to mate the TB of your M52TU or M54 engine to a M50B25 intake swap.
item.author: woutnieuw93

item.title: Release button for rear seats of VW Polo (or Golf)
item.description: A replacement release pin/button for the rear seats of a VW Polo 6N or Golf .
item.author: mcgrymelon

item.title: Kyrie (AS IS) SIMPLIFIED v0.2r
item.description:
PROPERTY OF SQUARE ENIX.

USED WITHOUT PERMISSION.

Source: Final Fantasy VII Remake

unfortunately i ripped the model in a lower LOD and only realized my error after i remodeled half of her face. it happens, but here she is in a simplified AS IS release. i really didn't feel like restoring any accessories once i descended into a shame spiral... so it is what it is.

hair is 2xSS and the rest is 3xSS. if only i moved a bit closer. live and learn, onward and upward or whatever...

i did manage to import her full-LOD eyes and lashes (which aren't positioned properly) but the rest of the objects are less than optimal. upon checking on her outfit and a few other parts that had pig polygons to begin with, there is little or no difference.

what a shame... such a nice model.........

i coulda been a contender.............
item.author: fASE-2

item.title: Shaving Station for medicine cabinet
item.description: I designed a hanging shaving station that is made to mount to the underside of a shelf in a medicine cabinet with 2 screws. There is a brush only as well as a brush and razor holder. The model is is to securely hold a brush knob with a 32mm neck, and the razor was designed for a Merkur Futur (13mm opening/16mm stem).
item.author: Jinxation

item.title: Aquarium suction cup replacement pin for 6mm hose
item.description:
Replacement pin/peg for aquarium suction cups to restrain 6mm hoses. The pins always break, so I figured I'd create a printable replacement.

It is tiny, so print with care at low speed.
item.author: ErikZandboer

item.title: Pegboard Double Glove Box holder
item.description: Designed to hold 2 boxes of disposable nitrile gloves (mine come from harbor freight but I figure the box size is probably standard) on pegboard with holes at 1 inch spacing. I made the pegs and surrounding area 100% infill. The pegs need supports.
item.author: iamjoshwilson

item.title: bead filler for cable gland Ducato x250 x290
item.description:
Hi there,

I created this thing because I needed to make sure, that my roof wouldn't leak at the position where the cables of my solar panels go through the roof.

If you use this, make sure to cover it in epoxy resin to make sure it's watertight.

I used ABS because it has good weather resistance.
item.author: WeetardFaphard

item.title: Creality Ender-3 Z-endstop
item.description: This is a cover for Ender-3 Z-end stop.
item.author: naedioba1

item.title: Fake1 without WASD Up button
item.description: Removed the WASD-style Up button and the slot for the toggle switch used to switch Up buttons. Only the top left part is changed so you can use the STLs from the original project for the rest of it.
item.author: JonnyHaystack

item.title: N95 FFP2 Mask Clip
item.description:
I found that my N95 Mask fit better and could be worn longer when fastening behind my head. This clip is quick and easy to print and works well for me.

No supports
PETG or PLA
No brim
item.author: sovtek

item.title: Thingiverse is dead to me - I migrated to PrusaPrinters
item.description:
Thingiverse is dead to me! I migrated to PrusaPrinters.org

Let's start the exodus together and let's migrate away from Thingiverse!.

Mark your account obsolete by including this model as your final upload!

Read more about my reasoning here: https://damsteen.nl/blog/2022/01/27/thingies-on-prusa-printers
My PrusaPrinters account: https://www.prusaprinters.org/social/170831-sebazzz/about

See you there!

Feel free to share and modify this model like you want!
item.author: Sebazzz

item.title: Caylus 1303 insert with covers
item.description:
Remixed previous insert that fix in the original game box.

Added covers to each of the boxes and adjusted height to exactly fit in their place. The covers have a fit system for them to click on their respective box and not fall off. Nothing will move if the game is stored vertically.

Also included logos on each cover for decoration and to allow seeing inside.

Uploaded alternative model without logod for each cover in case someone wants a completely closed box.

For the complete set you will need:
5 x Player box
5 x Player box cover (with or without meeples decoration)
1 x Points box
1 x Points box cover (with or without logo decoration)
1 x Resources box
1 x Resources box cover (with or without logo decoration)
item.author: Shermanito

item.title: 500 gallon propane tank (HO scale 1:87)
item.description: Generic 500 gallon propane tank in HO scale
item.author: realnuf

item.title: Beadfiller Ducato x250 x290
item.description:
Hi there,

I created this to mount my roof window onto my Ducato for a camper conversion. I made this from ABS to make sure it will withstand all kinds of weather as well as heat and cold.
To make it watertight, we covered these bead fillers with epoxy resin.

I will add some pictures soon.
item.author: WeetardFaphard

item.title: Tiny Cable Holder
item.description: I just needed one little cable holder. Maybe someone needs it too. Thanks to the Creator jb20200606. :)

item.title: 1-14 scale semi Trailer clearance light housing and lens
item.description: after seeing the crazy costs of a very simple light housing for my custom built scale semi trailers I decided to try my hand at a set , I'm pleased how they turned out

item.title: Clamp Lamp Arm Mount
item.description: Hi guys, This is my airbrush stations clamp lamp arm thingy. use M3 bolts and nuts on everything and it will work. Preferably print in petg its stronger than pla.
item.author: mkreinitz

item.title: Xiaomi WOW Stick Holder / 80 Bit Holder
item.description: This is just my take on a Xiaomi WOW Stick Holder. On my printer the bits and driver fit nicely with only a bit of wiggle. I included a fusion 360 file and all the important values are custom parameters that can easily be changed. It only holds the driver and 80bits as that is all I needed. I store the little magnetic mat elsewhere.
item.author: jeffreyk

item.title: Impress Jig Metal Stamps Art
item.description: I have just added a jig for a round stamp (9mm) and made a little modification so that no support is necessary. Thanks @cncartist for the great work!
item.author: zettlerm

item.title: HG P407 Gearbox mounted shifter servo conversion
item.description:
This conversion allows the user to mount the shifter servo on the gearbox of his or her HG P407/TamiyaBruiser.

Why would you do this?
-More direct shift with less play.
-Free up space at the rear of the hilux to make room for scale drop bed or accessories.
-Position weight further forward for improved crawling ability.

REQUIRED:
-Tie rod link from servo to gearbox.
-(Maybe)Longer bolts for mounting to gearbox.

Note:
-Be sure to print with the triangular part flat so that the grain of the print is will be at its strongest direction to work against the servos push/pull.
item.author: DanielJDesign

item.title: Borrachas Caixa do Filtro de Ar W203 ( Pré Facelift ) Airbox W203
item.description: Airbox of a mercedes w203 pré facilft, print in TPU 50% Infill

item.author: KPalivec

item.title: Useless Box - simple SG90
item.description:
Simple, because it uses no microcontroller. This is simply 2 AAA batteries, a 6-pin toggle switch, an SG90 servo, and a micro-limiter switch.

6-pin switch: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B079JBF815/
SG90 Servo: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B072V529YD/
Micro-Limiter: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07P23TWX2/
M*2 screws (various) https://www.amazon.com/dp/B08G8733Y4/
Paperclip (for battery box) https://www.amazon.com/dp/B09B9GPZ3T/

First, props to ericthepoolboy for drafting this tight little container. It was too small for my SG90, then I saw cogsy and blarbles had remixed. I have made minor tweaks, too, but it's very much based on--or fully using--what came before. Thanks y'all!

Remix
First: I modified the arm to create this harmonious curve of symmetry. It is thicker at the head and tail to better hit the targets, and it is sized to hit the toggle switch at just the right spot to maximize down-force and promote lateral movement. More on this below.
Second: strengthened the holes into which the micro-limiter fastens, and bumped it over a smidge (2mm.)
Third: added holes to the battery box for my paperclip concept.
Otherwise, it's just another remix of a remix.

The Arm and the Toggle Switch
A delicate secret lies at the heart of the Useless Box's operation. It is the ability of the arm to push the toggle. Many (most) 6-pin DPDT Toggle Switches are stiff and do not easily move. Hit 'em low and they won't budge. Hit 'em high and they resist. Some have found a solution in disassembling the DPDT and snipping the rod by 1-2mm and reassembling. This does allow the toggle to move more easily, but it also introduces errors as the rod may sometimes not have enough pressure on it to maintain contact with the contact-plate. Delicate business. Last resort. Ill advised. Do Not Mangle Toggle. Better to use a whole un-mangled DPDT. And for that, you need to hit it at just the right spot. Thus have I labored. Behold: The harmonious curve of symmetry that is The Perfect Arm. This arm is a perfect fit for the box provided. Adjustments to the box dimensions may require adjustments to the arm. But knowing that it can be done should help you persevere to success.

Screws
In addition to the materials listed above (with links) you'll need a variety of M2 screws.
M212(x2) for limiter switch
M212(x2) for the flip lid "hinge"
M210(x2) for the servo
M28(x1) for the arm
M2*8(x4) for the DPDT lid

Paperclip
Gonna need one jumbo paperclip (see picture.) This is for the battery box, to make connections.

How To
With the two wiring diagrams provided you should be able to get there. Everything connects to the DPDT (6-pin toggle switch.) In both of the diagrams (annotated & Frizing) please assume the toggle is leaning to the right, away from the servo. Doesn't matter really, tho, bc you can simply rotate the toggle switch if you wire it backwards. :-)

Battery ground (-) connects to Upper right (-). Upper right (-) connects to Lower left (-). Battery juice (+) connects to Lower right (+). Lower right (+) connects to Limiter Pinchy end (+). Limiter Open end connects to DPDT Upper left. (Limiter middle stays empty.) Servo (+) connects to DPDT Lower middle. Servo (-) connects to Upper middle.

SG90
Unscrew & remove "lid". De-solder wires from motor. You won't use the circuit board or the (+) (-) & (data) wires, so you can remove the board if ya like but I have trouble with that so just snip the 3 wires down to the nub and snip the old motor wires. You'll then solder new wires to the motor (+) & (-). These will goto the DPDT. Preparing the SG90 is easy.

Keep your wires short as you can as it's a tight fit in this box.

The DIY-Battery Box is a bit rough and tumble. See pics for how I arranged a paperclip to serve here. One end of the box (away from the limiter switch) has two holes, the end nearest the limiter switch has 4 holes. Arrange a paperclip through the two holes such that it contacts both batteries. Arrange clips through the other side such that it only contacts one battery. There is enough room here to create a hoop and drop a stake between wall and hoop. This creates enough pressure to keep contacts in contact with battery. Note which wire you have connected to the (+) pin on your DPDT, that is where your (+) battery should go.

Where did this project begin? Earliest record I can find is this instructables from 2009. That's where the annotated wiring diagram comes from. The Fritzing diagram is mine own.

Rubber feet on the bottom help this sit nicely wherever.

Where to Improve
Looking to make an improvement? The Battery Holder is a good place to start.

Video
https://youtu.be/M8kQxafmoNA
item.author: Chiyetanka
